title: Exploring International Students’ E-Learning Experiences in Australian Online Higher Education: Autoethnography-Based Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in foundational online learning tools and intermediate English communication skills
context.additional_context: Analysis of international students’ e-learning adaptation processes and improvement strategies under smartphone-centric, limited-technology access conditions in Australian university settings.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically document and analyze their e-learning experiences using autoethnography methodology and explain learning behavior patterns.
Learners can evaluate online learning environments and propose improvements by applying Biggs’ 3P Model (Presage-Process-Product).
Learners can identify factors causing cultural differences and social isolation in VR simulation environments and design alternative communication strategies.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
